Sheba, the name of a place in Palestine, and of two Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Bikri, an Israelite
to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
near, with or among; often in general, to
Joab, the name of three Israelites
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
Joab, the name of three Israelites
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
near, with or among; often in general, to
a king

23.brief: Joab, the name of three Israelites
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
Benajah, the name of twelve Israelites
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jehojada, the name of three Israelites
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

24.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, a burden (as causing to faint), i.e. a tax in the form of forced labor
Jehoshaphat, the name of six Israelites; also of a valley near Jerusalem
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male

25.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
Tsadok, the name of eight or nine Israelites
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)

26.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
Ira, the name of three Israelites
a Jairite or descendant of Jair
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
David, the youngest son of Jesse
